contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Takuma'''|詫間町|Takuma-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in the former [[Mitoyo District, Kagawa|Mitoyo District]], [[Kagawa Prefecture|Kagawa]], [[Japan]]. On January 1, 2006 Takuma was merged with the towns of [[Mino, Kagawa|Mino]], [[Nio, Kagawa|Nio]], [[Saita, Kagawa|Saita]], [[Takase, Kagawa|Takase]], [[Toyonaka, Kagawa|Toyonaka]] and [[Yamamoto, Kagawa|Yamamoto]], all from [[Mitoyo District, Kagawa|Mitoyo District]], to form the new city of [[Mitoyo, Kagawa|Mitoyo]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 15,179 and a [[population density|density]] of 488.23 persons per km². The total area was 31.09 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.mitoyo.lg.jp/ Official website of Mitoyo] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kagawa Prefecture]] {{Kagawa-geo-stub}}
